title: Diddy's Thanksgiving meal in jail revealed after his private island plea got rejected
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs will spend Thanksgiving in Brooklyn's Metropolitan Detention Center after his house arrest plea was denied. As Diddy will be spending Thanksgiving in jail, People reported the menu he will be offered on November 28. His breakfast at 6 AM will include fruit, cereal and breakfast pastries. His 11 AM lunch will include turkey roast or hot & sour tofu with sides like mashed potatoes, mixed vegetables, cranberry sauce, turkey gravy and dinner rolls served along with assorted holiday pie.
summary: Sean "Diddy" Combs will spend Thanksgiving in Brooklyn's Metropolitan Detention Center after his house arrest plea was denied.  As Diddy will be spending Thanksgiving in jail, People reported the menu he will be offered on November 28. His breakfast at 6 AM will include fruit, cereal and breakfast pastries. His 11 AM lunch will include turkey roast or hot & sour tofu with sides like mashed potatoes, mixed vegetables, cranberry sauce, turkey gravy and dinner rolls served along with assorted holiday pie.

title: Jack Smith files motion to dismiss Jan 6 case against Donald Trump before his inauguration
content: Special counsel Jack Smith moved to dismiss the four charges against President-elect Donald Trump related to the 2020 election plot. Citing longstanding DOJ policy, Smith argued that the Constitution requires dismissal before Trump's inauguration. The Justice Department maintains that sitting presidents cannot be prosecuted.
summary: Special counsel Jack Smith moved to dismiss the four charges against President-elect Donald Trump related to the 2020 election plot. Citing longstanding DOJ policy, Smith argued that the Constitution requires dismissal before Trump's inauguration. The Justice Department maintains that sitting presidents cannot be prosecuted.

title: Hindu and Sikh leaders join calls for assisted dying bill in UK to be opposed
Tens of thousands of PTI protesters reach outskirts of Islamabad
content: Tens of thousands of PTI supporters marched on Islamabad demanding Imran Khan's release and reversal of a constitutional amendment. Clashes erupted with police, who used tear gas and made arrests. The government vowed to stop the protest, blocking routes and deploying security forces.
summary: Tens of thousands of PTI supporters marched on Islamabad demanding Imran Khan's release and reversal of a constitutional amendment.  Clashes erupted with police, who used tear gas and made arrests.  The government vowed to stop the protest, blocking routes and deploying security forces.

title: Did Rachel Maddow cry over Elon Musk’s meme about buying MSNBC? Here’s the truth
content: A manipulated video falsely depicted Rachel Maddow crying over Elon Musk's meme about buying MSNBC. The original 2018 footage showed Maddow's emotional response to a report on migrant family separations. Musk's meme fueled speculation about MSNBC's future amid rumors of Comcast spinning off its cable channels. While Musk joked about the purchase, no official plans have been confirmed.
summary: A manipulated video falsely depicted Rachel Maddow crying over Elon Musk's meme about buying MSNBC. The original 2018 footage showed Maddow's emotional response to a report on migrant family separations.  Musk's meme fueled speculation about MSNBC's future amid rumors of Comcast spinning off its cable channels.  While Musk joked about the purchase, no official plans have been confirmed.

title: Kamala Harris tells allies to keep her options open: 2028 or California Guv race
content: ​A former campaign aide said Harris does not need to rush to decide whether she wants to run for something again in the next six months. All she needs to do is to remain visible. "The natural thing to do would be to set up some type of entity that would give her the opportunity to travel and give speeches and preserve her political relationships," the former aide said.
summary: ​A former campaign aide said Harris does not need to rush to decide whether she wants to run for something again in the next six months. All she needs to do is to remain visible. "The natural thing to do would be to set up some type of entity that would give her the opportunity to travel and give speeches and preserve her political relationships," the former aide said.

title: Floods disrupt life across UK in aftermath of Storm Bert
2-year-old girl from El Salvador says she's come to US alone to find her parents
content: A two-year-old migrant girl was found alone at the US border, claiming to be searching for her parents. She is among 60 unaccompanied minors detained in Texas on Sunday. Officials highlight the dangers of child trafficking, while Texas Governor Greg Abbott plans border security measures with newly appointed "border czar" Tom Homan.
summary: A two-year-old migrant girl was found alone at the US border, claiming to be searching for her parents.  She is among 60 unaccompanied minors detained in Texas on Sunday.  Officials highlight the dangers of child trafficking, while Texas Governor Greg Abbott plans border security measures with newly appointed "border czar" Tom Homan.

title: ‘Bulls**t’: Axios CEO Jim VandeHei criticises Elon Musk over citizen journalism claims
content: Axios CEO Jim VandeHei clashed with Elon Musk over the future of journalism. VandeHei defended professional reporting, criticizing Musk's view that "citizen journalists" with blue checkmarks can replace trained reporters. He compared journalism to neurosurgery, emphasizing the need for expertise. Musk retorted dismissively, claiming legacy media recognizes the shift in power to individual users on platforms like X.
summary: Axios CEO Jim VandeHei clashed with Elon Musk over the future of journalism.  VandeHei defended professional reporting, criticizing Musk's view that "citizen journalists" with blue checkmarks can replace trained reporters.  He compared journalism to neurosurgery, emphasizing the need for expertise. Musk retorted dismissively, claiming legacy media recognizes the shift in power to individual users on platforms like X.

title: Why Diddy served a cease-and-desist to Shyne for 1999 shooting incident
content: In the Hulu documentary, which debuted on November 18, Shyne reportedly implied that Diddy’s current legal troubles were reflective of his past actions. In interviews promoting the documentary, Shyne allegedly expressed his disappointment with Diddy, claiming that Diddy had destroyed his life and caused significant hardship for his family. He shared that, during his prison term, he felt abandoned by Diddy while others celebrated the music mogul’s success.
summary: In the Hulu documentary, which debuted on November 18, Shyne reportedly implied that Diddy’s current legal troubles were reflective of his past actions. In interviews promoting the documentary, Shyne allegedly expressed his disappointment with Diddy, claiming that Diddy had destroyed his life and caused significant hardship for his family. He shared that, during his prison term, he felt abandoned by Diddy while others celebrated the music mogul’s success.

title: Bill Clinton says Trump's cabinet is about loyalty 'no matter who gets hurt'
content: Former President Bill Clinton said he was not surprised at Donald Trump's cabinet selections in a recent MSNBC interview. He said Trump's priority is loyalty over qualifications. Among many other things, including Monica Lewinski, Clinton's new memoir 'Citizen: My life after the White House' addressed allegations of West Wing damage during his transition, as he denied involvement in the mischief.
summary: Former President Bill Clinton said he was not surprised at Donald Trump's cabinet selections in a recent MSNBC interview. He said Trump's priority is loyalty over qualifications.  Among many other things, including Monica Lewinski, Clinton's new memoir 'Citizen: My life after the White House' addressed allegations of West Wing damage during his transition, as he denied involvement in the mischief.

title: When Wayne Rooney coached Barron Trump and golfed with Donald Trump
content: In 2018, Rooney and his family were invited to the White House for a Christmas event. This coincided with his tenure at D.C. United, where he scored 25 goals in 52 appearances, revitalizing the team and solidifying his reputation as a global soccer icon. During the White House visit, the Rooneys met Donald Trump, who expressed an interest in having Rooney coach his youngest son, Barron.
summary: In 2018, Rooney and his family were invited to the White House for a Christmas event. This coincided with his tenure at D.C. United, where he scored 25 goals in 52 appearances, revitalizing the team and solidifying his reputation as a global soccer icon. During the White House visit, the Rooneys met Donald Trump, who expressed an interest in having Rooney coach his youngest son, Barron.

title: ‘Vomited blood, found unconscious’: Last moments of Danish backpackers in Laos
content: Six foreign nationals, including two young Danish women, tragically died from suspected methanol poisoning in Vang Vieng, Laos, after consuming tainted alcohol. The Danish women, Anne-Sofie Orkild Coyman and Freja Vennervald Sorensen, experienced severe symptoms before their deaths. Four other individuals, including two Australian teenagers and a British lawyer, also perished.
summary: Six foreign nationals, including two young Danish women, tragically died from suspected methanol poisoning in Vang Vieng, Laos, after consuming tainted alcohol. The Danish women, Anne-Sofie Orkild Coyman and Freja Vennervald Sorensen, experienced severe symptoms before their deaths. Four other individuals, including two Australian teenagers and a British lawyer, also perished.

title: Justin Trudeau trolled for 2011's 'porn site QR code problem' post. Here's what happened back then
content: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's 2011 social media post about a QR code mishap resurfaced amidst criticism of his attendance at a Taylor Swift concert during anti-Israel protests. The old post, regarding a porn site link, was an April Fool's joke, but has returned to haunt him online. Trudeau condemned the Montreal riots and called for accountability.
summary: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's 2011 social media post about a QR code mishap resurfaced amidst criticism of his attendance at a Taylor Swift concert during anti-Israel protests.  The old post, regarding a porn site link, was an April Fool's joke, but has returned to haunt him online.  Trudeau condemned the Montreal riots and called for accountability.

title: #MeToo Hypocrisy: JK Rowling slams pool authorities in Canada for allowing ‘muscular man’ in girl's bathroom
content: JK Rowling has reignited debate on gender identity policies, critiquing their potential conflict with safeguarding women and girls. She highlighted perceived hypocrisy within progressive circles, contrasting #MeToo’s focus on male predation with support for policies allowing individuals to access facilities based on self-declared gender identity. Rowling referenced a Canadian incident where a muscular man in a sparkly bikini used a female changing room, upsetting young girls. The facility defended its inclusivity policies under human rights laws, suggesting uncomfortable individuals use private spaces instead. The mother involved criticized the lack of consideration for women's safety, echoing broader concerns about similar incidents.
summary: JK Rowling has reignited debate on gender identity policies, critiquing their potential conflict with safeguarding women and girls. She highlighted perceived hypocrisy within progressive circles, contrasting #MeToo’s focus on male predation with support for policies allowing individuals to access facilities based on self-declared gender identity. Rowling referenced a Canadian incident where a muscular man in a sparkly bikini used a female changing room, upsetting young girls. The facility defended its inclusivity policies under human rights laws, suggesting uncomfortable individuals use private spaces instead. The mother involved criticized the lack of consideration for women's safety, echoing broader concerns about similar incidents.

title: How Elon Musk's love story became a bitter custody battle
content: Grimes, born Claire Boucher, and Elon Musk made headlines when they first revealed their relationship in 2018. The pairing was unexpected: Grimes, known for her experimental music and avant-garde aesthetic, and Musk, the tech mogul behind Tesla, SpaceX, and Neuralink, represented two seemingly opposite worlds. Yet, their union was marked by a shared fascination with technology, futurism, and a penchant for pushing boundaries. Fans of the couple were intrigued by their eccentricity—whether it was naming their first child X Æ A-12 or collaborating on ideas about artificial intelligence.
summary: Grimes, born Claire Boucher, and Elon Musk made headlines when they first revealed their relationship in 2018. The pairing was unexpected: Grimes, known for her experimental music and avant-garde aesthetic, and Musk, the tech mogul behind Tesla, SpaceX, and Neuralink, represented two seemingly opposite worlds. Yet, their union was marked by a shared fascination with technology, futurism, and a penchant for pushing boundaries. Fans of the couple were intrigued by their eccentricity—whether it was naming their first child X Æ A-12 or collaborating on ideas about artificial intelligence.

title: Elon Musk's Tesla ignored faulty furnace door, 100 degrees floor temperatures: Report
content: A Wall Street Journal report revealed Tesla's alleged environmental violations in Austin, including dumping untreated wastewater and covering up a faulty furnace. A whistleblower alerted the EPA, claiming that Tesla asked him to lie to regulators. The report comes as Elon Musk along with Vivek Ramaswamy will head the Department of Government Efficiency cutting the government's expenditure and deleting regulations.
summary: A Wall Street Journal report revealed Tesla's alleged environmental violations in Austin, including dumping untreated wastewater and covering up a faulty furnace. A whistleblower alerted the EPA, claiming that Tesla asked him to lie to regulators.  The report comes as Elon Musk along with Vivek Ramaswamy will head the Department of Government Efficiency cutting the government's expenditure and deleting regulations.

title: Ukrainian boxer slams Joe Rogan: 'You are using Putin's only weapon propaganda'
content: Joe Rogan criticized US military aid to Ukraine, arguing it could trigger World War III. Ukrainian boxer Wladimir Klitschko accused Rogan of echoing Russian propaganda and offered to debate him on the podcast. Rogan's team dismissed Klitschko's offer as an attempt to appear on the podcast but social media users, including Bill Ackman, said Rogan should have Klitschko on his podcast.
summary: Joe Rogan criticized US military aid to Ukraine, arguing it could trigger World War III.  Ukrainian boxer Wladimir Klitschko accused Rogan of echoing Russian propaganda and offered to debate him on the podcast.  Rogan's team dismissed Klitschko's offer as an attempt to appear on the podcast but social media users, including Bill Ackman, said Rogan should have Klitschko on his podcast.

title: No house arrest for Diddy: What we know about 'Star Island'
content: Sean "Diddy" Combs's request for house arrest at his $35 million Star Island mansion has been denied. A judge ruled that the hip-hop mogul, facing sex trafficking and abuse charges, poses too significant a risk for obstruction and remains in Brooklyn's Metropolitan Detention Center. His trial is scheduled for May 2024.
summary: Sean "Diddy" Combs's request for house arrest at his $35 million Star Island mansion has been denied.  A judge ruled that the hip-hop mogul, facing sex trafficking and abuse charges, poses too significant a risk for obstruction and remains in Brooklyn's Metropolitan Detention Center.  His trial is scheduled for May 2024.

title: Pakistan protests: PTI supporters continue march towards Islamabad demanding leader Imran Khan's release
content: Hundreds of Imran Khan's supporters marched towards Islamabad, demanding his release. Authorities imposed a security lockdown, leading to clashes. Khan's wife vowed to continue the protest until his release. The march, facing obstacles, aimed to reach Islamabad by midweek, challenging the government and its handling of the situation.
summary: Hundreds of Imran Khan's supporters marched towards Islamabad, demanding his release.  Authorities imposed a security lockdown, leading to clashes.  Khan's wife vowed to continue the protest until his release.  The march, facing obstacles, aimed to reach Islamabad by midweek, challenging the government and its handling of the situation.
